message_1: Consider the set X = {1, 2, 3} with the discrete topology. What is the closure of {1, 2}?
message_2: In the discrete topology, every subset of X is an open set, including the singletons {1}, {2}, and {3}. The closure of a set A is the smallest closed set containing A. In the discrete topology, every set is also closed, including the set A itself. Therefore, the closure of {1, 2} is simply {1, 2}.
